importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the most current update regarding the NFL game between the Philadelphia Eagles and Minnesota Vikings, providing context for real-time sports news and team performance evaluation.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The critical moment when Jalen Hurts executed a 45-yard rainbow pass to A.J. Brown to seal the victory highlights the decisive play that turned the game in the Eagles' favor during a narrow final stretch.

keyTakeAways: Jalen Hurts delivered a standout performance, throwing for 326 yards and three touchdowns, and showcasing his Super Bowl MVP-level form.
A.J. Brown and DeVonta Smith had key receiving performances, with Smith recording a career-high 183 receiving yards including a 79-yard touchdown.
The Eagles overcame two consecutive losses and defeated the Minnesota Vikings 28-22, rebounding from a struggling start.
Jalyx Hunt returned an interception for a touchdown, adding a critical defensive play to the Eagles' win.
Carson Wentz struggled in the game, going 26 for 42 with two interceptions and poor red-zone performances, showing a contrast in offensive execution between the two quarterbacks.
The Eagles' offensive coordinator Kevin Patullo regained credibility with well-timed plays and fourth-down conversions, helping stabilize the offense.

Key injuries affected both teams: Eagles lost Cam Jurgens (knee), Azeez Ojulari (hamstring), Jeremiah Trotter (ankle), and Adoree’ Jackson (concussion); Vikings missed Andrew Van Ginkel (neck) for the third straight game.
The Eagles are set to play the New York Giants next Sunday, while the Vikings face the Los Angeles Chargers on Thursday.

namedEntities.name: Jalen Hurts
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hurts was the primary driver of the Eagles’ offensive revival, throwing for 326 yards and three touchdowns, and executing a game-winning 45-yard pass to A.J. Brown.

namedEntities.name: A.J. Brown
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Brown scored two touchdowns and was a key target for Hurts, contributing significantly to the Eagles’ offensive output.

namedEntities.name: DeVonta Smith
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Smith recorded a career-high 183 receiving yards and a 79-yard touchdown, showing elite performance and helping shift momentum.

namedEntities.name: Jalyx Hunt
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hunt returned an interception for a touchdown, providing a crucial defensive spark in the game.

namedEntities.name: Carson Wentz
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Wentz struggled with two interceptions and poor red-zone performances, contrasting with Hurts’ dominant showing and highlighting team performance differences.

namedEntities.name: Kevin Patullo
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Patullo made effective in-game adjustments, including well-timed fourth-down conversions and play-action schemes, which helped stabilize and improve the Eagles’ offense.

namedEntities.name: Nick Sirianni
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Sirianni expressed confidence in Hurts and praised the team’s cohesion, emphasizing trust in the quarterback and team unity.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Eagles
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Eagles rebounded from two consecutive losses to defeat the Vikings 28-22, showing resilience and improved offensive coordination under Hurts.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Vikings, who had a 3-3 record, struggled offensively and defensively, particularly in red zones and against key Eagles plays.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Out with a neck injury for the third straight game, impacting Vikings' defensive performance.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Philadelphia Eagles rebounded from two consecutive losses by defeating the Minnesota Vikings 28-22 on Sunday, thanks to a revitalized passing game led by quarterback Jalen Hurts. Hurts threw for 326 yards and three touchdowns, including a game-winning 45-yard pass to A.J. Brown, and DeVonta Smith posted a career-high 183 receiving yards with a 79-yard touchdown. Jalyx Hunt added a touchdown with an interception return. The Eagles’ offensive coordinator Kevin Patullo made key adjustments that stabilized the offense, while Carson Wentz struggled with two interceptions and poor red-zone performance. Injuries to key players on both sides — including Cam Jurgens, Azeez Ojulari, Jeremiah Trotter, Adoree’ Jackson, and Andrew Van Ginkel — affected team depth and play. The Eagles are now set to face the New York Giants, while the Vikings travel to play the Los Angeles Chargers.
title: Eagles Rebound with Hurts' Game-Winning Performance Against Vikings
